name: Moong Dal Chilla
history: Moong Dal Chilla, also known as Pesarattu in South India, is a traditional Indian pancake. It's made from split green gram and is a popular breakfast item.
description: Moong Dal Chilla is a nutritious and delicious pancake made from ground moong dal (split green gram). It's typically spiced with ginger, green chilies, and onions, making it a flavorful and wholesome meal.

instructions.title: Prepare the Batter
instructions.description: Drain the soaked moong dal and grind it with ginger, green chilies, and water to make a smooth batter. Transfer to a bowl and add salt, chopped onions, and cumin seeds.

instructions.title: Cook the Chilla
instructions.description: Heat a non-stick pan and grease it lightly with oil. Pour a ladleful of batter and spread it evenly. Cook on medium heat until the edges start to lift. Flip and cook the other side.

instructions.title: Serve
instructions.description: Serve the Moong Dal Chilla hot, garnished with chopped coriander leaves.

tips: The consistency of the batter should be similar to pancake batter.
Cook the chilla on medium heat for even cooking and to prevent it from burning.
variations: Add grated vegetables like carrots or spinach to the batter for added nutrition.
Experiment with different herbs and spices for variety.

storage.shelfLife: Batter can be refrigerated for up to 1 day.
storage.instructions: Store the batter in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat cooked chillas on a skillet until warm.
presentationTips: Serve with a side of mint-coriander chutney or yogurt.
